meanings.definition: Free from anything of a different, inferior, or contaminating kind; unmixed.
meanings.sent1: The water in the mountain stream was the purest I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: She wore the purest white dress on her wedding day.
meanings.sent3: The purest joy filled his heart when he saw his newborn baby.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was the purest melody in the entire choir.
meanings.sent5: The purest snowflakes fell gently from the sky, covering the ground in a blanket of white.

meanings.definition: Containing nothing that does not properly belong; unadulterated.
meanings.sent1: The cake was made with the purest ingredients, making it delicious.
meanings.sent2: His intentions were purest, with no hidden agenda.
meanings.sent3: The purest laughter erupted from the children playing in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the purest expression of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The purest gold shone brightly in the sunlight, untouched by impurities.

meanings.definition: Free from moral fault or guilt.
meanings.sent1: His actions were always guided by the purest intentions.
meanings.sent2: She had the purest heart, always helping those in need.
meanings.sent3: The purest kindness radiated from her every gesture.
meanings.sent4: His words were the purest form of comfort in times of sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The purest love knows no boundaries, transcending all obstacles.

meanings.sent1: The royal family's lineage was the purest in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: She was of the purest bloodline, tracing her ancestry back centuries.
meanings.sent3: The purest heritage was passed down through generations.
meanings.sent4: His heritage was the purest, with no dilution from other lineages.
meanings.sent5: The purest traditions were upheld by the community, honoring their ancestors.
